snippet: After a weeklong strike, Chicago teachers and the school board said that they had the outlines of a contract deal. Schools in the nation’s third largest district are expected to reopen on Monday.
abstract: Leaders on both sides of Chicago's teacher contract dispute announce that they have reached the outlines of a deal, five days into a strike that halted classes for 350,000 students across the city; agreement has not yet been formally drafted and Teachers Union leaders have not yet voted to approve it.

byline.original: By MONICA DAVEY and STEVEN YACCINO

lead_paragraph: After a weeklong strike, Chicago teachers and the school board said that they had the outlines of a contract deal. Schools in the nation’s third largest district are expected to reopen on Monday.

headline.seo: Chicago Teachers Reach Tentative Contract Deal
headline.main: Chicago Forges Outline to End Teacher Strike
headline.print_headline: Chicago Forges Outline to End Teacher Strike
